data.scientific_title: Boosting effectiveness of new vaccines for dengue ,HFMD and influenza by targeting vaccine antigens to Clec9A on dendritic cells.
data.field_of_research: Applied Immunology (incl. Antibody Engineering, Xenotransplantation and T-cell Therapies)
data.simplified_title: Targeting dendritic cells to boost vaccines against dengue, HFMD and influenza.
data.sub_type: A*STAR - Utilising Integrative Technologies to Combat Emerging Infectious Disease
data.source_system: Australian and Singapore laboratories will collaborate to develop improved vaccines against virus diseases, particularly Dengue, Hand Foot and Mouth Disease and Influenza. A novel technology will be used, the targeting of vaccines to a receptor on the surface of the dendritic cells that control immune responses. This will be used to boost responses to a series of vaccine candidates that are otherwise insufficiently immunogenic.
